channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Photos: See the fall of Damascus after Syrian rebels topple Assad's regime
item.description: Assad's downfall came less than two weeks after an initial incursion west of the country's second largest city, Aleppo, triggered a cascading series of routs and retreats by the demoralized Syrian military.
item.content:encoded:
Assad's downfall came less than two weeks after an initial incursion west of the country's second largest city, Aleppo, triggered a cascading series of routs and retreats by the demoralized Syrian military.

(Image credit: Omar Sanadiki)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Syrians ransack Assad's private residence in Damascus after the regime's downfall
item.description: The private residence of deposed Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad was ransacked after rebels took over the capital, forcing him to flee the country.
item.content:encoded:
The private residence of deposed Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad was ransacked after rebels took over the capital, forcing him to flee the country.

(Image credit: Hussein Malla)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Trump focuses on tariffs, not retribution, in first network TV interview
item.description: President-elect Trump lays out plan for his first 100 days during interview with NBC News' "Meet the Press."
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Trump lays out plan for his first 100 days during interview with NBC News' "Meet the Press."

(Image credit: Heather Khalifa)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Cancer interrupted their school lives, but also set them on a mission
item.description: Pediatric cancer survival rates are a crowning medical achievement. But the impact of missing school is a less-discussed side effect children then face.
item.content:encoded:
These Happy Golden Years. At 10, center, she is pictured in the hospital where she was treated for thyroid cancer. For Beck and her family, the Happy Golden Years image became emblematic of her life, before. At right, EJ Beck today is a 23-year-old medical student.'/>

Pediatric cancer survival rates are a crowning medical achievement. But the impact of missing school is a less-discussed side effect children then face.

(Image credit: Beck family; José A. Alvarado Jr. for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: PHOTOS: Take a ride with the Elephant Response Team. And be careful!
item.description: Their job is to keep the peace amid a worsening and at times deadly conflict between humans and the world's largest land animal in the town of Livingstone, Zambia.
item.content:encoded:
Their job is to keep the peace amid a worsening and at times deadly conflict between humans and the world's largest land animal in the town of Livingstone, Zambia.

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Text and photos by Tommy Trenchard

item.title: NYPD releases 2 new photos of man sought in killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO
item.description: Late Saturday, police released two additional photos of the suspected shooter that appeared to be from a camera mounted inside a taxi.
item.content:encoded:
Late Saturday, police released two additional photos of the suspected shooter that appeared to be from a camera mounted inside a taxi.

(Image credit: NYPD)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: John Lithgow on having a "good ending" — on and off screen
item.description: Actor John Lithgow grew up in a theater family but always wanted to be a painter. On Wild Card this week, he opens up what changed his mind.
item.content:encoded:
Actor John Lithgow grew up in a theater family but always wanted to be a painter. On Wild Card this week, he opens up what changed his mind.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: In Syria, the Assads leave a bitter legacy after a half-century of repressive rule
item.description: President Bashar Assad and his father, Hafez Assad, combined to rule Syria for more than 50 years, always with an iron fist that crushed dissent and relied on the country's feared security forces.
item.content:encoded:
President Bashar Assad and his father, Hafez Assad, combined to rule Syria for more than 50 years, always with an iron fist that crushed dissent and relied on the country's feared security forces.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Assad is granted asylum in Russia as rebels seize control of the Syrian capital
item.description: The Syrian government collapsed early Sunday, as rebels seized control of the capital Damascus. Deposed President Bashar al-Assad was granted asylum by Russia, according to state-run Tass news.
item.content:encoded:
The Syrian government collapsed early Sunday, as rebels seized control of the capital Damascus. Deposed President Bashar al-Assad was granted asylum by Russia, according to state-run Tass news.

(Image credit: Omar Sanadiki)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Photos: Notre Dame Cathedral reopens, with its first service since a devastating fire
item.description: The bells of Notre Dame Cathedral rang on Saturday evening in Paris for the first time since a fire heavily damaged the Paris landmark in 2019.
item.content:encoded:
The bells of Notre Dame Cathedral rang on Saturday evening in Paris for the first time since a fire heavily damaged the Paris landmark in 2019.

(Image credit: Ludovic Marin)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek
